results.title: Immediate and short-term cardiovascular effects of a new converting enzyme inhibitor (lisinopril) in essential hypertension.
results.text_hl: Thus, the decrease in arterial pressure produced by @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ was associated with improved renal hemodynamics and reduced left @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular@@@ mass.

citations.NLM: Garavaglia GE, Messerli FH, Nunez BD, Schmieder RE, Frohlich ED. Immediate and short-term cardiovascular effects of a new converting enzyme inhibitor (lisinopril) in essential hypertension. Am J Cardiol. 1988 Nov 1;62(13):912-6. PMID: 2845768
citations.BibTeX: @article{2845768, title={Immediate and short-term cardiovascular effects of a new converting enzyme inhibitor (lisinopril) in essential hypertension.}, author={Garavaglia GE and Messerli FH and Nunez BD and Schmieder RE and Frohlich ED}, journal={Am J Cardiol}, volume={62}, number={13}, pages={912-6}}

results.title: Effects of lisinopril upon cardiac hypertrophy, central and peripheral hemodynamics and neurohumoral factors in spontaneously hypertensive rats.
results.text_hl: Cardiac index, renal blood flow, leg muscle blood flow, plasma @GENE_REN @GENE_24715 @@@renin@@@ activity, @GENE_NPPA @GENE_24602 @@@atrial natriuretic peptide@@@ level, and @CHEMICAL_Norepinephrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009638 @@@norepinephrine@@@ concentration were determined. RESULTS: @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ decreased body weight, blood pressure and left @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular@@@ weight and increased leg muscle blood flow; cardiac index and renal blood flow were unaltered.

citations.NLM: Nishimura H, Kubota J, Okabe M, Ueyama M, Kawamura K. Effects of lisinopril upon cardiac hypertrophy, central and peripheral hemodynamics and neurohumoral factors in spontaneously hypertensive rats. J Hypertens. 1992 May;10(5):431-6. PMID: 1317903
citations.BibTeX: @article{1317903, title={Effects of lisinopril upon cardiac hypertrophy, central and peripheral hemodynamics and neurohumoral factors in spontaneously hypertensive rats.}, author={Nishimura H and Kubota J and Okabe M and Ueyama M and Kawamura K}, journal={J Hypertens}, volume={10}, number={5}, pages={431-6}}

results.title: Two-year follow-up study to evaluate the reduction of left ventricular mass and diastolic function in mild to moderate diastolic hypertensive patients.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: The effects of @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ on left @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular@@@ mass and early to atrial filling peak velocity after 2 years of treatment were similar and these effects were already observed after 1 year of treatment.

citations.NLM: Beltman F, Heesen W, Smit A, May J, de Graeff P, Havinga T, Schuurman F, van der Veur E, Lie K, Meyboom-de Jong B. Two-year follow-up study to evaluate the reduction of left ventricular mass and diastolic function in mild to moderate diastolic hypertensive patients. J Hypertens Suppl. 1998 Oct;16(6):S15-9. PMID: 9856379
citations.BibTeX: @article{9856379, title={Two-year follow-up study to evaluate the reduction of left ventricular mass and diastolic function in mild to moderate diastolic hypertensive patients.}, author={Beltman F and Heesen W and Smit A and May J and de Graeff P and Havinga T and Schuurman F and van der Veur E and Lie K and Meyboom-de Jong B}, journal={J Hypertens Suppl}, volume={16}, number={6}, pages={S15-9}}

results.title: Effects of lisinopril vs hydralazine on left ventricular hypertrophy and ambulatory blood pressure monitoring in essential hypertension.
results.text_hl: Left @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular@@@ mass was significantly reduced by @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ but not by @CHEMICAL_Hydralazine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006830 @@@hydralazine@@@.

citations.NLM: Fogari R, Zoppi A, Mugellini A, Tettamanti F, Lusardi P, Corradi L. Effects of lisinopril vs hydralazine on left ventricular hypertrophy and ambulatory blood pressure monitoring in essential hypertension. Eur Heart J. 1995 Aug;16(8):1120-5. PMID: 8665975
citations.BibTeX: @article{8665975, title={Effects of lisinopril vs hydralazine on left ventricular hypertrophy and ambulatory blood pressure monitoring in essential hypertension.}, author={Fogari R and Zoppi A and Mugellini A and Tettamanti F and Lusardi P and Corradi L}, journal={Eur Heart J}, volume={16}, number={8}, pages={1120-5}}

results.title: Protective effect of ACE inhibitors on ischemia-reperfusion-induced arrhythmias in rats: is this effect related to the free radical scavenging action of these drugs?
results.text_hl: These drugs also attenuated the incidence of reversible @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular fibrillation@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@VF@@@) and the number of @DISEASE_Ventricular_Premature_Complexes @DISEASE_MESH:D018879 @@@ventricular ectopic beats@@@ (@DISEASE_Ventricular_Premature_Complexes @DISEASE_MESH:D018879 @@@VEB@@@) during reperfusion.

citations.NLM: Birincioglu M, Aksoy T, Olmez E, Acet A. Protective effect of ACE inhibitors on ischemia-reperfusion-induced arrhythmias in rats: is this effect related to the free radical scavenging action of these drugs? Free Radic Res. 1997 Oct;27(4):389-96. PMID: 9416467
citations.BibTeX: @article{9416467, title={Protective effect of ACE inhibitors on ischemia-reperfusion-induced arrhythmias in rats: is this effect related to the free radical scavenging action of these drugs?}, author={Birincioglu M and Aksoy T and Olmez E and Acet A}, journal={Free Radic Res}, volume={27}, number={4}, pages={389-96}}

results.title: Relative Importance of Aortic Stiffness and Volume as Predictors of Treatment-Induced Improvement in Left Ventricular Mass Index in Dialysis
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@Hypertension@@@ in Hemodialysis @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ Treated with @CHEMICAL_Atenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ trial compared the effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ versus @CHEMICAL_Atenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in reducing left @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular@@@ mass index; 179 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with echo measurements of aortic pulse wave velocity and left @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular@@@ mass at baseline were included.

citations.NLM: Georgianos PI, Agarwal R. Relative Importance of Aortic Stiffness and Volume as Predictors of Treatment-Induced Improvement in Left Ventricular Mass Index in Dialysis PLoS One. 2015;10(9):e0135457. PMID: 26356419
citations.BibTeX: @article{26356419, title={Relative Importance of Aortic Stiffness and Volume as Predictors of Treatment-Induced Improvement in Left Ventricular Mass Index in Dialysis}, author={Georgianos PI and Agarwal R}, journal={PLoS One}, volume={10}, number={9}, pages={e0135457}}

results.title: The smoothness index: a new, reproducible and clinically relevant measure of the homogeneity of the blood pressure reduction with treatment for hypertension.
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_9606 @@@PATIENTS@@@ AND METHODS: In 174 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with essential @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and @DISEASE_Hypertrophy_Left_Ventricular @DISEASE_MESH:D017379 @@@left ventricular hypertrophy@@@, enrolled in the Study on Ambulatory Monitoring of @DISEASE_Pressure_Ulcer @DISEASE_MESH:D003668 @@@Pressure@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ Evaluation (SAMPLE), aged 20-65 years, we measured clinic blood @DISEASE_Pressure_Ulcer @DISEASE_MESH:D003668 @@@pressure@@@, 24 h ambulatory blood @DISEASE_Pressure_Ulcer @DISEASE_MESH:D003668 @@@pressure@@@ and the left @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular@@@ mass index (echocardiography) before and after treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ at 20 mg with the addition of 12.5 or 25 mg @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@ as needed to reach a sufficient blood @DISEASE_Pressure_Ulcer @DISEASE_MESH:D003668 @@@pressure@@@ reduction.

citations.NLM: Parati G, Omboni S, Rizzoni D, Agabiti-Rosei E, Mancia G. The smoothness index: a new, reproducible and clinically relevant measure of the homogeneity of the blood pressure reduction with treatment for hypertension. J Hypertens. 1998 Nov;16(11):1685-91. PMID: 9856370
citations.BibTeX: @article{9856370, title={The smoothness index: a new, reproducible and clinically relevant measure of the homogeneity of the blood pressure reduction with treatment for hypertension.}, author={Parati G and Omboni S and Rizzoni D and Agabiti-Rosei E and Mancia G}, journal={J Hypertens}, volume={16}, number={11}, pages={1685-91}}

results.title: [Stiffness of the Arterial Wall and Central Hemodynamics During Long-Term Combination Antihypertensive Therapy].
results.text_hl: Combination therapy was associated with persistent lowering of central arterial pressure, decrease of augmentation index and other parameters of arterial wall stiffness, and reduction of left @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular myocardial@@@ mass.

citations.NLM: Prokofieva EB, Glezer MG. [Stiffness of the Arterial Wall and Central Hemodynamics During Long-Term Combination Antihypertensive Therapy]. Kardiologiia. 2015;55(4):19-24. PMID: 26502498
citations.BibTeX: @article{26502498, title={[Stiffness of the Arterial Wall and Central Hemodynamics During Long-Term Combination Antihypertensive Therapy].}, author={Prokofieva EB and Glezer MG}, journal={Kardiologiia}, volume={55}, number={4}, pages={19-24}}
